segment.source: How to Set Up Publishing Servers
segment.target: How to Set Up Publishing Servers

segment.source: How to Set Up Publishing Servers
segment.target: How to Set Up Publishing Servers

segment.source: How to Set Up Publishing Servers
segment.target: How to Set Up Publishing Servers

segment.source: You can use the following procedures to add and configure Application Virtualization Servers directly from the Client Management Console.
segment.target: You can use the following procedures to add and configure Application Virtualization Servers directly from the Client Management Console.

segment.source: To add an application publishing server
segment.target: To add an application publishing server

segment.source: In the Results pane, right-click and select New Server from the pop-up-menu to start the New Application Virtualization Server Wizard, or alternatively, right-click the Publishing Server node and select New Server from the pop-up-menu.
segment.target: In the Results pane, right-click and select New Server from the pop-up-menu to start the New Application Virtualization Server Wizard, or alternatively, right-click the Publishing Server node and select New Server from the pop-up-menu.

segment.source: On page one of the wizard, enter the name of the server in the Display Name field and select the server type from the Type drop-down list.
segment.target: On page one of the wizard, enter the name of the server in the Display Name field and select the server type from the Type drop-down list.

segment.source: You can choose Application Virtualization Server, Enhanced Security Application Virtualization Server, Standard HTTP Server, or Enhanced Security HTTP Server from the drop-down list of server types.
segment.target: You can choose Application Virtualization Server, Enhanced Security Application Virtualization Server, Standard HTTP Server, or Enhanced Security HTTP Server from the drop-down list of server types.

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: On page two of the wizard, type the appropriate information into the Host Name and Port fields.
segment.target: On page two of the wizard, type the appropriate information into the Host Name and Port fields.

segment.source: The Path field is not editable for Application Virtualization Servers.
segment.target: The Path field is not editable for Application Virtualization Servers.

segment.source: You must enter a path for Standard HTTP Server or Enhanced Security HTTP Server.
segment.target: You must enter a path for Standard HTTP Server or Enhanced Security HTTP Server.

segment.source: Click Finish to add the server.
segment.target: Click Finish to add the server.

segment.source: To set up an application publishing server
segment.target: To set up an application publishing server

segment.source: In the Results pane, right-click the desired server and select Properties from the pop-up menu.
segment.target: In the Results pane, right-click the desired server and select Properties from the pop-up menu.

segment.source: Click the General tab, where you can change the server name, select a type from the drop-down list of server types, and specify the host name and port.
segment.target: Click the General tab, where you can change the server name, select a type from the drop-down list of server types, and specify the host name and port.

segment.source: When the server type is Standard HTTP Server or Enhanced Security HTTP Server, the Path field is also editable.
segment.target: When the server type is Standard HTTP Server or Enhanced Security HTTP Server, the Path field is also editable.

segment.source: Click the Refresh tab, where the Refresh publishing on user login check box is selected by default.
segment.target: Click the Refresh tab, where the Refresh publishing on user login check box is selected by default.

segment.source: To change the refresh rate, select the Refresh publishing every check box and enter a number that represents the frequency in the field.
segment.target: To change the refresh rate, select the Refresh publishing every check box and enter a number that represents the frequency in the field.

segment.source: Then select Minutes, Hours, Days from the drop-down menu.
segment.target: Then select Minutes, Hours, Days from the drop-down menu.

segment.source: (The minimum amount of time you can enter is 30 minutes.)
segment.target: (The minimum amount of time you can enter is 30 minutes.)

segment.source: Click Apply to change the configuration.
segment.target: Click Apply to change the configuration.

segment.source: When you are finished publishing, click OK to exit the dialog box and return to the Client Management Console.
segment.target: When you are finished publishing, click OK to exit the dialog box and return to the Client Management Console.

segment.target: Related topics

segment.target: How to Disable or Modify Disconnected Operation Mode Settings
